DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this randomized study was to compare the impact of two different radial arterial catheters - 20G and 22G - on the changes of diameter, blood flow and velocity of radial artery and ulnar artery after induction of anesthesia and after cannulation.
DOC.brief_title: Ultrasonographic Evaluation of the Radial and Ulnar Blood Flow After Radial Arterial Cannulation
DOC.criteria: The patient who are scheduled for elective surgery and need arterial cannulation Coronary occlusive disease Known or suspected upper extremity peripheral arterial disease Coagulopathy DM with peripheral neuropathy Infection at puncture site
